summary: Build a functional Transport Booking Website using React frontend + Motoko backend with canister storage only (no external APIs/services). Includes homepage booking flow, vehicle listings with images, owner profile section, secure admin dashboard to manage bookings, and a public booking-status lookup page; styled as a premium dark-blue/yellow ride-booking UI.
architectural_notes: Tech constraints: React frontend + Motoko backend only; persist data in canister storage (no Node/Firebase/MongoDB/external APIs/payment gateways).
Data model includes bookings (with ID, customer/trip fields, status) and vehicles (name, image, driver).

existing_features.title: Create a modern, premium homepage that includes: (1) a hero section, (2) the headline text exactly "Book Reliable Transport Instantly", and (3) a prominent booking form card; ensure smooth UI interactions and mobile responsiveness.

Implement a working booking submission flow: the booking form must collect Name, Phone, Pickup, Drop, Date, Time, Vehicle, Notes; on submit, persist the booking to Motoko canister storage and show the success message exactly "Booking Request Submitted".

Add a Vehicle section that renders vehicle cards for the following entries and shows each vehicle image and driver name: Pickup Truck – Mukesh; Pickup Truck – Jainul; Pickup Truck – Hazrat; Innova Crysta – Sukumar Ruj; Mahindra Tractor – Manjhalo. Vehicle images must be real-looking (photorealistic) and included as static frontend assets (no external image URLs).

Create an Owner section with a profile card that includes: circular image upload (client-side), owner name "Manoj Kumar Das", title text "Owner", and contact buttons for phone (8294950710) and email (riteshdas58888@gmail.com).

Implement a secure Admin Panel at route /admin with login required using Internet Identity; only authorized admin principals may access the dashboard. The dashboard must list all bookings with customer info, provide a booking status selector, and a delete booking button. Admin actions must update canister-stored data.
Create a public Booking Status Check page at route /status where a customer can enter either a phone number or a booking ID and see matching booking(s) and their current status from canister storage.

Apply a premium ride-booking UI style across all pages using a dark blue base with yellow accents, rounded cards, shadows, smooth animations, and mobile-responsive layouts; keep all user-facing text in English.

Add a default Owner profile image (from the user-uploaded photo IMG-20250504-WA0039_Original.jpeg) as a static frontend asset and display it in the Owner profile circle when the user has not uploaded a replacement image yet.

Update the Owner section component at frontend/src/components/OwnerSection.tsx to use the user-uploaded image file IMG-20250504-WA0039_Original-1.jpeg as the default owner profile picture when no custom image has been selected via the image upload control.
Update frontend/src/components/VehiclesSection.tsx so that the Pickup Truck vehicle card(s) display the uploaded image "IMG_6733-1.jpeg" as their vehicle image in the fleet grid.
